inter_groups:
Recognizing cultural diversity as enrichment for Europe which would facilitate advancement of human rights and solidarity for the common good of the societies.  
Assisting in participatory democratic processes, voting rights and citizenship, and advising their fellow citizens in those respects
eu_initiatives:
ThinkOut has the support of and works in partnership with civil society organisations dealing with human rights issues such as European Commission against Racism and Intolerance (ECRI), Organisation of the Islamic Cooperation (OIC), EU Fundamental Rights Agency, ODIHR, ENAR, CEJI, UNIW, Fair International, Emisco and the International University of Sarajevo. 
Thinkout works closely with the media, politicians and authorities to highlight and facilitate the legitimate needs and fundamental rights of ethnic and religious minorities.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: Elkilic#Ayse, Günes#Bekir, KARA#Abdil, Korkut#Sevim, Sönmez#Hakan, TASKIRAN#Sultan, TOPDEMIR#Fatih
membership: OSCE / Odihr HDIM meetings and UN Forum for Minority Issues
goals__remit:
THINKOUT is an NGO that aims to work to strengthen and reinforce social cohesion in the new European realities. This New Europe will therefore be better equipped to tackle the socio-economical crises which hit us since the last ten years.  
ThinkOut organizes events that deal with human rights issues such as anti-Muslim hate crimes, racism, and minority rights and takes a proactive approach to promoting social cohesion.
